Sequence Information.Peptide Name: V16M (N-terminal GSKKP deleted, thanatin analog, synthetic AMPs, 1S=S, UCSS1a)
Sequence Information.Source: sequence truncation, insects, animal-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (76.19%) toThanatinR: 19%, I=C: 13%.Chemical modification: disulfide bond C6-C13 based on the truncated sequence.Activity: active against Gram+ A. viridans (MIC 1.2-2.5 uM), M. luteus (MIC 2.5-5 uM), B. megaterium (MIC 5-10 uM), B. subtilis (MIC 20-40 uM), S-aureus (MIC > 40 uM), P. acidolactici (MIC 20-40 uM), Gram- E. coli D22 or D31 (MIC 0.6-1.2 uM) strain 106 >40 uM, S-typhimurium (MIC >40 uM), K. pneumoniae (MIC 2.5-5 uM), E. cloacae (MIC 5-10 uM), E. carotovora (MIC 20-40 uM), P-aeruginosa (MIC >40 uM), fungi N. crassa (MIC 10-20 uM), B. cinerea (MIC 10-20 uM), N. haematococca (MIC 5-10 uM), T. viride (MIC 20-40 uM), A. brassicola (MIC 5-10 uM), F. culmorum (MIC 10-20 uM), A. pisi (MIC 20-40 uM), and F-oxysporum (MIC >40 uM).
Literature Information.Author: Fehlbaum P, Bulet P, Chernysh S, Briand JP, Roussel JP, Letellier L, Hetru C, Hoffmann JA. 1996
Literature Information.Reference: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 1996 Feb 6;93(3):1221-5. doi: 10.1073/pnas.93.3.1221.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Structure-activity analysis of thanatin, a 21-residue inducible insect defense peptide with sequence homology to frog skin antimicrobial peptides.
